# Introduction

George Boole (1815 - 1864) was born in Lincoln and died in Cork. He was a self-taught mathematician and educationalist, who was too poor to attend Cambridge yet became the foundation professor of mathematics at Cork and a Fellow of the Royal Society (@machale2014life).
